Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= referent to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= causative action by which humans or deities inflict sorrow and suffering on (other) humans

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: to crush; hence: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to suffer harm and humiliation, ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans do not treat other humans well and do not give them the respect they deserve
marker affirming or questioning the truth value of the information that follows
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= state in which a condition or process takes place for an indefnite amount of time, ◄ as if it lives in that place
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= action by which humans or deities express their disapproval of something with words
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which someone acts towards someone else in a morally or ethically unacceptable manner

= combination of two or three nets in layers, usually a small mesh inner net sandwiched between two nets of looser mesh; ► set out vertically in the water, held in place by floats on the surface of the water and weighted down by a single weighted rope at the bottom; left in place for several hours to give time for fish to accumulate in it; ≈ associated with aggression and control|= construction of which the exact form is unknown, ► built in order to gain access to a city during a siege
= to behave aggressively towards someone with which one has a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= causative action by which someone builds a structure to restrict others from going their normal way

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= action by which a human being takes off one or more pieces of someone else's clothing

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event

= a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose it is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
= person with whom someone is acquainted in an intimate way
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= process by which humans lose their interest in associating with other humans or in serving a deity
= process by which objects stop existing in this world
= person with whom someone is acquainted in an intimate way

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an אָמָה appears to have a somewhat higher status than a שִׁפְחָה even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= person who comes from a foreign country and therefore has a different status from those who are native born

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to beg for mercy|to make supplication
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans try to win a favorable attitude from deities or from other humans ◄ by approaching that deity or person in a very humble way

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= to arouse in someone else an emotion of disgust, rejection
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= causative action by which humans arouse in other humans an feeling of disgust, so that they do not want to associate with them
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: people of friendship; hence: = people with whom one has an affectionate relationship
literally: people of friendship; hence: = people with whom one has an affectionate relationship
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= state in which an object is positioned around or against another object in such a way that the two cannot be separated easily
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to touch; hence: = causative action by which humans, deities or forces cause harm to humans or objects
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: to carve|to portray|to draw|to mark out|to write
Node.definition: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction
= short, sharp piece of iron; ► used for engraving marks, usually writing or drawing, on stone or metal; ≈ associated with conditions that are permanent and are not likely to change
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= a heavy bluish grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security
= action by which humans engrave words in stone with the use of a sharp object
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed
= the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
literally: to be finished; hence: = process by which humans feel physically weak as a result of hardship or a deeply felt wish for something to happen
literally: kidney; hence: = seat of a person's emotions and devotion to God, created by God, and hidden to everyone but God himself

= front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
literally: root of a matter; hence: = a person or event that gives rise to (another) event
literally: to find (in someone); hence: = process by which humans come upon certain information
= state in which humans experience a strong fear of other humans, deities, or animals
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
